snippet: Sixteen-year-olds in New York belong in the juvenile system, not in adult courts or prisons.
abstract: Editorial faults New York for being one of two remaining states in which 16-year-olds are automatically tried as adults; cites evidence showing that sending children into adult courts, rather than juvenile justice system, harms both offenders and public by turning children into hardened criminals; calls on New York to raise age for adult criminal prosecution.
lead_paragraph: Sixteen-year-olds in New York belong in the juvenile system, not in adult courts or prisons.
